page.title: 18Forest Freeminers (Parkend)
page.content: Coalmining was once one of the Forest of Dean's most important industries.Now only a small number of mines are actually worked in the area .Maps and information about all the small mines in the Forest are kept in the Deputy Gavellers office in Coleford.Anyone can apply to buy and work a small mine but few people can belong to an associatoin in the Forest called ,"The Freminers Association".This is made up of a group of men, all of whom have gained the right to called freeminers.To become a freeminer one must:(a) Be male. (b) Have been born within the hundred of St.Briavels.(This is specifficlly defied area within the Forest of Dean).(c)Have worked in a mine for one year and one day Freemineing is one of the Forests oldest traditions.
